OCD.name: MqttDataTransport
OCD.description: The MqttDataTransport provides an MQTT connection. Its configuration parameters are used to determine the MQTT broker and the credentials to connect to the broker.

AD.name: Broker-url
AD.description: URL of the MQTT broker to connect to, specifying protocol, hostname and port (for example mqtt://your.broker.url:1883/ ). Supported protocols are mqtt, mqtts, ws and wss.

AD.name: Topic Context Account-Name
AD.description: The value of this attribute will replace the '#account-name' token found in publishing topics. For connections to remote management servers, this is generally the name of the server side account.

AD.name: Username
AD.description: Username to be used when connecting to the MQTT broker.

AD.name: Password
AD.description: Password to be used when connecting to the MQTT broker.

AD.name: Client-id
AD.description: Client identifier to be used when connecting to the MQTT broker. The identifier has to be unique within your account. Characters '/', '+', '#' and '.' are invalid and they will be replaced by '-'. If left empty, this is automatically determined by the client software as the MAC address of the main network interface (in general uppercase and without ':').

AD.name: Keep-alive
AD.description: Frequency in seconds for the periodic MQTT PING message.

AD.name: Timeout
AD.description: Timeout used for all interactions with the MQTT broker.

AD.name: LWT Topic
AD.description: MQTT Last Will and Testament topic. The tokens '#account-name' and '#client-id' will be replaced by the values of the properties topic.context.account-name and client-id

AD.name: LWT Payload
AD.description: MQTT Last Will and Testament payload as a string.

AD.name: LWT Qos
AD.description: MQTT Last Will and Testament QoS (0..2).

AD.name: LWT Retain
AD.description: MQTT Last Will and Testament Retain flag.

AD.name: In-flight Persistence
AD.description: Storage type where in-flight messages are persisted across reconnections.

AD.name: SslManagerService Target Filter
AD.description: Specifies, as an OSGi target filter, the pid of the SslManagerService used to create SSL connections.
